main_definition: Involving active participation or engagement from all parties involved.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Relating to communication that involves both sending and receiving input
meanings_and_examples.example: The interactive whiteboard allowed students and teachers to write, draw, and discuss together in real-time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A system or process where two or more parties can communicate with each other
meanings_and_examples.example: Online gaming platforms are highly interactive as players from around the world can join games and chat with one another.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Involving actions that respond to user input or behavior in real-time
meanings_and_examples.example: Interactive fiction stories change their plot based on the choices a reader makes within the story.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A system, software, or activity where users can provide feedback, modify content, or make decisions that affect outcomes
meanings_and_examples.example: An interactive tutorial in an e-learning course allows students to practice skills and receive instant corrections from the program.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A method of learning that involves a dialogue between instructor and student, where both contribute actively to the process
meanings_and_examples.example: The interactive class discussion allowed each student to voice their thoughts on the topic being discussed.
